column5: Anybody ever been to Camp Waterfall near Kenora. Appears to be a nice relaxing place to take the wife. I was wondering what the fishing is like on the Rushing River/Blind Lake ?

Great place, cheap prices and good fishing, was up there several years ago in june for eyes. Blindfold had some of the biggest crappies that I have ever seen, and lots of them, norhterns plenty. We portaged into LOW for eyes on the lift. It was a great time, we went the first week of june. Good luck Troyz
Is there walleye in Blindfold Lake or Do you have to portage to LOTW for walleyes ? Also, How far a drive would this be to Lac Seul ? Thanks for your response.
Is there a website for camp waterfall for resorts?

I believe their are eyes in blindfold, but we fished LOW for eyes. I do not know how to lac suel, it just over an hour to vermillion bay. I do not know if the have a website? I went with a group of guy that have been going there for years, it was a blast. Good fishing Troyz

Blackjack2 Here is an excerpt from a brochure from Tyc's Blindfold Lake Resort: "Fishing, especially in spring and fall, is regarded as excellent - producing Northern Pike, Walleye (pickerel), Bass, Perch, and Crappie. Access to Lake of the Woods enables you to transfer to the bigger waters for a change of pace. If I'm reading this right, must be walleye in Blindfold Lake. Marv
scott791 Here is the website. www.duenorth.net/campwaterfall/ Marv
